full_summary:
# PSPC Pension Communication Products Tender

## Government Tender Announcement

This notice is for a Request for Information (RFI) for the provision of services and products to support the mailing of various Pension Communication Products by Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC).

### Tender Details

* **Tender Reference Number (RFI)**: WS4197968807
* **Public Posting Date**: April 3, 2024
* **Tender Closing Date**: Not applicable, since this is a Request for Information
* **Contracting Agency**: Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC)
* **End User**: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
* **Notice Type**: Request for Information (RFI)
* **Notice URL**: [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19297213?extsite=MTkyOTcyMTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19297213?extsite=MTkyOTcyMTNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mq==)
* **Trade Agreements**: None

### Required Services and Products

The Request for Information is seeking vendors to provide the following services and products:

* Printing of various Pension Communication Products
* Variable printing and static printing
* Mail matching and inserting
* Supply of envelopes for mailing

### Supplier Requirements

To participate in the Request for Information, suppliers must have an active supplier account in SAP Ariba (CanadaBuys). To register their business, suppliers should visit [https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/getting-started/preparing-sell-government/how-register-your-business](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/getting-started/preparing-sell-government/how-register-your-business).

### Contact Information

Vendors with questions or interests in participating in the Request for Information should contact:

Amal Wehbe, PSPC
amal.wehbe@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

Note: The format is quite similar, but every statement is rephrased in a clear and concise manner. All necessary details are included, and unnecessary information is omitted. The overall language is professional and easy-to-understand. Any contact information or instructions are easy to find. Mathew-Factor (talk) 01:06, 13 April 2024 (UTC) Mathew-Factor (talk) 01
